channel.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
channel.description: Starting college this semester, wondering if anyone had a good, reputable site that sells/rents textbooks. I want the cheapest it can be, and I prefer the book quality to be good. If it helps, I live in the United States.

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

I get all of mine on Facebook groups:

UCONN Buy and Sell
Textbook Exchange
UCONN Class of 2015
etc.

Other students tend to sell books for as low as 10% of their original price. I got a $300 book for $40 today.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

Ask for people that are 1 year higher, to buy their old text books

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @marcbob marcbob
item.description:
@marcbob wrote:

It’s a scam where I go. You can’t get used textbooks because the teachers release new versions every year with new stuff in them so you have to get the new ones.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“the elve age, post:7, topic:528724”][quote author=Niall link=topic=647477.msg4354648#msg4354648 date=1377282081]
Ask the professor if the books required for the course are even necessary, and if they are, if the latest version is required. You might be able to get away with buying a 1-2 year old book.
[/quote]I’ve done this out of all the suggestions so far; I feel like I can find a better website than Amazon or Ebay.[/quote]Ask your professor if he/she has any former students who he has contact information for who he/she might think would sell their old copy. A lot of times professors ( at least out where I live) would become fairly nice friends with his/her students.

inb4somebodytakesthatinapervway

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @Null_Amount N_A
item.description:
@Null_Amount wrote:

I’ve heard good reviews about Chegg. My siblings used it as well when they were in school.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:6, topic:528724”]Ask the professor if the books required for the course are even necessary, and if they are, if the latest version is required. You might be able to get away with buying a 1-2 year old book.[/quote]I’ve done this out of all the suggestions so far; I feel like I can find a better website than Amazon or Ebay.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Ask the professor if the books required for the course are even necessary, and if they are, if the latest version is required. You might be able to get away with buying a 1-2 year old book.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @Muroth Muroth
item.description:
@Muroth wrote:

My sister rents textbooks from Amazon and returns them when she’s done. They’re pretty cheap. Amazon also buys any text books for college courses.

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Amazon > school bookstore, unless it’s one of those “school only books” which have to be bought through them
Most colleges offer some sort of trading/discounted option through other students (we do ours through a Facebook group)

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

You can sometimes find the books for the kindle or whatever it’s called for like 5-10$ so check there first!

The university I went to school as well had a “trade in” thing where students would sell each other their used textbooks to each other. (not to the bookstore cause you don’t get crap there lol)

Check like a student bulletin board there!

Read full topic

item.title: Where should I buy textbooks?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

amazon and ebay tend to be just fine

can also check halfpricedbooks I guess

Read full topic
